required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Posterior Nasal Neurectomy With Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery for Chronic Rhinosinusitis With Nasal Polyposis:A Comparative Study
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Posterior Nasal Neurectomy With Functional Endoscopic Sinus Surgery for Chronic Rhinosinusitis With Nasal Polyposis :A Comparative Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study will be conducted to investigate the efficacy of posterior nasal neurectomy in control of recurrence and improvment of allergic symptoms in patients with allergic rhinitis combined with nasal polyposis

detailed_description.textblock: Allergic rhinitis patients with nasal polyposis will go through FESS combined with posterior nasal neurectomy to detect recurrence rate

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of posterior nasal neurectomy on recurrence rate in allergic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis
primary_outcome.description: Surgical procedure to evaluate the recurrence of nasal polyposis

arm_group.description: We will do posterior nasal neurectomy in patients with allergic rhinitis after FESS in one side of the nose
We will do FESS only in the other side of the nose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all cases presented to ENT department Assuit University with allergic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusing enrollment into the study. Pregnant women Refusing surgery Containdication to surgery Patients with aspirin syndrome

reference.citation: Mengeling WL. Anamnestic immune response of pigs to pseudorabies virus: latent virus reactivation versus direct oronasal and parenteral exposure to virus. J Vet Diagn Invest. 1991 Apr;3(2):133-6.
